definition: "water" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 85), occurring in 没, 法, 流 etc/see also 三點水|三点水[san1 dian3 shui3]
intercalary/an extra day or month inserted into the lunar or solar calendar (such as February 29)
mellow and full/suave/smooth and round/rich (in voice)
Chow Yun-Fat (1955-), Hong Kong TV and film star
to permeate/to percolate/fig. to saturate (with emotion)
Fengrun district of Tangshan city 唐山市[Tang2 shan1 shi4], Hebei
to polish (a piece of writing)/to add a few finishing touches to (a piece of writing, painting etc)

sentences.english: The book was polished time and again so that its style is similar to that of the Eastern Han Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 其書在形成過程中被一再脩潤，故其文風類似東漢人。

sentences.english: Pandas eat have to drink water embellish throat dragon.
sentences.chinese: 熊貓喫飽飽了還得喝水潤潤喉龍。

sentences.english: Everybody to save a drop of water, formed a clear spring embellish the world.
sentences.chinese: 人人節約一滴水，匯成清泉潤世界。

sentences.english: Besides, it can also whiten the skin around eyes, smooth away dark eye circles.
sentences.chinese: 同時潤白眼部皮膚，淡化黑眼圈。

sentences.english: The culture of jproposinge is the seven thousand year's culture of China ;
sentences.chinese: 玉的文明就是中國七千多年的文明，潤珠寶。
